reviews.review_text: I love coming to Pink Peppercorn and it never disappoints! Every time I come i always rotate with the rack of lamb or the seafood pasta. The rack of lamb is always cooked to perfection and the mashed potatoes is to die for because it s not like any mashed potatoes I ve ever had its sweet but savory at the same time. The portions are big plenty of veggies on the plate and presentation is always beautiful. The seafood pasta is so delish! I love the variety and amount of seafood that it comes with. Today my friend and I shared the mushroom soup. It was one of the features of the night and it was the best mushroom soup I ve ever tasted! Rich, creamy and packed with flavor! I loved how the mushroom was blended but u can still taste the mushrooms and it had a nice garlic flavor. I wish it was a permanent item on the menu I d take this mushroom soup over the clam chowder anytime! Our servers Arturo and Teddy bear both give great service with a great sense of humor! Hopefully next time I ll try something else off the menu!

I had to write a review after my family and I had a fantastic dinner last night at Pink Peppercorn. It is my brother s favourite place, but it has been a while for me since I no longer live nearby. Not only did the food exceed our expectations, so did the service. I had the smoked sablefish, which was accompanied by a huge portion of veggies. It was a good portion, and super well plated. Others had the New York steak, cedar planked salmon, the salmon Wellington, and rack of lamb. Everyone was super happy with their meals. We also ordered the calamari starter, which was very fresh! The meal came with their complimentary warm bread and lobster oil, which was divine. The star was our server. The lone man appeared to be working the entire restaurant alone. Serving, taking orders, and even bartending. He didn t skip a beat, and I was blown away. He deserves 5 stars and a big raise/bonus! Thank you for a wonderful evening,

Never disappoints! Went here for birthday and Father s Day. Regardless of the day of the week - service is always so great. Food is excellent Tip: as good as the bread and lobster oil is- don t go nuts - lol the entrees are massive.

Wow! One of the best places for seafood in Vancouver for sure! I visited yesterday for the first time and tried quite a few items from their menu - I loved everything. I also need to mention that everyone was super friendly and the service great.

Old school seafood joint, and i mean that in the most complimentary manner. We loved it here, we had a professional waiter - a fellow who could read the table, make recommendations and have facility with the menu. It s a rare skill these days and is a lost art. I value old school anything so I feel this is a restaurant meant for people who know what they want. It s not an effete molecular cuisine restaurant or a fish and chip joint.  The portions are generous and the flavours are dynamic- if pepper, garlic and onion are your friends, you need to run here as soon as possible. We will Return , we had the smoked sablefish and the salmon Wellington and wish I had an extra stomach to try the other dishes.

Wonderfully presented meals that will impress your eyes and belly!  The service is professional, engaging and seamless. The place was at full capacity yet our appetizers and entrees were served exceptionally fast. Its obvious the kitchen is run at a high standard. The seafood and vegetables taste like they were pulled from the ocean and garden that day. Notably the lobster bisque was rich and creamy while the mixed seafood pasta was loaded with clams,salmon, scallops and prawns. Definitely try the smokey, buttery Alaskan Cod as it is absolutely delicious. The trio of tartar was light refreshing and super tasty. I have been here twice and both times I have left  feeling  like the meals were prepared by someone who loves you.

My wife and I came here for dinner to celebrate our 6th anniversary. Outside may look odd but inside is very clean, cute and classy! Very elegant and romantic ambiance, tasty food and good service. Maitre chef helped us with our choices and our waiter Teddy Bear made sure we enjoy this special moment. I highly recommend this place and will definitely invite my family and friends here again! Vegetarian options: They also offer some vegetarian options Parking: Street parking available in back alley Kid-friendliness: We saw kids with their parents here. No complaints

The salmon wellington here is one of the best I ve ever had! The service here is phenomenal and portions are huge    once you try the mashed potatoes paired with their special gravy.. you ll be dreaming about going back!

Definitely a  hole in the wall  to try! It s nothing super fancy but a good restaurant for date night, celebrating an occasion or just going out! I wouldn t recommend the cocktails- not the best to be honest so go for the wine. The food was amazing. The seafood platter was incredibly large for a 1 person portion! Tasted fresh. The calamari was very large- bit greasy and that didn t sit best in the stomach. SO when the salmon Wellington main came- it was hard to really dig in and enjoy it! But oh man- as leftovers, the large portion of salmon Wellington was so so delicious. The mash potatoes and veggies did taste a bit too buttery and sat heavy. Also- the pictures below is ONE entree split into 2. Definitely not leaving hungry. Amazing service! Will definitely come back and try the halibut!

We were vising and our last night we wanted to experience Canadian seafood. When we arrived for our res. the place had just become super bz. They had one server at the time and he was amazing and excellent. Running a one man show and the food was amazing and vast quantity
Such a unique experience and a nice changed for Vancouver. This spot is super cozy and the decoration is very cute. We got the chefs specials and they were quite nice.

This was my first time trying this place, and I will definitely be back. The food and service is incredible and the ambience is intimate and cozy. I booked a table for 6 and everyone left raving about their meals. I ordered the west coast bouillabaisse, the portion was large and the flavours of the well-seasoned broth came together perfectly.

Had a birthday celebration for 12 people. The restaurant was packed. Reservation was delayed about 30 minutes. Server was very polite and apologized for the delay. Appies came very fast, the warm papaya salad was delicious as was the fresh oysters and mussels. Entrees we re salmon Wellington, seafood linguine, New York steak and sable fish. Everything was so good and tasty. A definite repeat for sure. Make sure you have reservations.

Very traditional service seafood/steak restaurant. Servers are professional and know their menu well. Food is perfect but watch out the portion is pretty big.  Complimentary bread with prawns oil vinegar dip is so good   that we forgot to take pictures
Their lobster oil is Big portions, I enjoyed their salmon Wellington. Food

I was recommended this place and we finally went today OMG !!! BEST SEAFOOD PLACE IN VANCOUVER and i dont even like seafood! Is flavorful, cook to perfection! Nice staff, nice atmosphere, i will definitely come back! I was wondering why almost everyone asked for a box to go, and then i realized that is because the portions are really big! I also asked for a box to go and will have a delicious lunch tomorrow! 100% recommended

Very honest, Ive known and heard of this place for a very long time but never made a trip to try it. Like many others, I really regret not trying it out sooner because this place was phenomenal. The type of dishes they put are classics. Nothing experimental, but just straightforward really well executed food. All the dishes were well seasoned, cooked to perfection and came at a timely manner. The waiter Teddy Bear was charming and attentive, ensuring my Chinese parents always had a constant flow of hot water. Portions were insanely fair priced. I ordered the salmon wellington which was stuffed with small shrimp and a large portion of salmon. Pastry was a perfect thickness, flakey and not soggy. Calamari and the trio tartar was also a favourite tonight, and we cant forget about the insanely flavorful lobster oil with bread. Looking forward to coming back again! Book early, this place really fills up on the weekends!

We came here to celebrate my birthday. I m so regretful that I didn t know this restaurant earlier! We got clams chowder, lamb and lobster. And we got creme brulee for dessert. The food quality is so good and values the price. Servants are kind, friendly, and have a good sense of humour. We spent a good night here. I like this place and will definitely recommend it to my friend.

Fist time here and for sure not the last one! Amazing food, rich flavours, well presented plates and fair price! Staff is very nice and friendly, Arturo was very helpful and accommodating. I recommend this place! I will come back to try all the other different dishes.
Its a nice experience celebrating my birthday, such a lovely people very welcoming most specially our server Teddy  bear(Asim).Food is exceptional, you will never go wrong of any of their menu.

Amazing food and staff! Especially Paul! So great with recommendations. We had the Salmon Wellington with the pan seared oysters for a starter. Portions are fantastic, and the meal was amazing. If you get a chance, book a reservation and check it out. You definitely won t be disappointed! Cheers!

Amazing service and delicious food! I loved that the portions were quite big for fine dining and the food just melted in our mouths. Great atmosphere for date nights and family gatherings and our server made our evening so enjoyable! We will definitely be back soon!

Delicious food and excellent service. That lobster oil is awesome! The portion is very good for a high end restaurant. We were stuffed by the end of the meal. Between the two of us, we shared a soup, a salad and an appy and two main entrees. We definitely underestimated the portions. The prawn and papaya salad is very good. Highly recommend it. Overall, definitely would come again.

We had an incredible dinner and fantastic service that made our 20th Anniversary so special. They provided large proportions, flavorful and fresh seafood and veggies. To top off, they gave us a complimentary dessert to celebrate our special occasion. We look forward to coming back again. Thanks.

Our friend took us out to dinner, it was amazing!  The food was excellent and tasty.  I had the seafood platter and the Halibut special. The seafood platter had a little bit of everything, a must have if you love seafood.  I will be coming back.  The staff were super friendly making us feel at home.

I usually dont like fine dining because of the price and portion just dont  justify, but definitely not the case here! Everything was so tasty at the restaurant. When the scallop appetizer came we pretty much just cleaned the plate. Like what I have read on the reviews, the portion was very generous!! Because food was so good we ended up ordering more food so we could try different things lol And yes we had to pack food home, I could only finish half of my plate. Also our server Teddybear was very nice and friendly providing excellent service! We will come back to try more items on the menu.

My son treated me and my family to my birthday celebration. It was THE Best and top quality seafood that I had ever had. We ordered shared plates of the Seafood Platter, and Calamari, theyre delicious. I had my Seafood Bouillabaisse, which is so well done. Dessert was exquisite. Verdict: My family and I will come back     .

This review is a bit late. My husband took me here for my Birthday October 30. We were very happy with the service right from the moment we walked in the door. Every staff member including the chef definitely think and value their customers. We cant wait until we can return to this fabulous place

Amazing, attentive, and professional staff. Cant say enough good things about the crew there this evening. Every dish was delicious and the portions are GIGANTIC. Either plan on sharing or taking stuff home. I had the bouillabaisse and it was loaded with clams, mussels, salmon, cod, halibut, sable fish, and scallops. The broth had just the right amount of spicy kick (for a non spicy eater) and had plenty of vegetables as well. Save some of the bread to dip in the broth My kids had the calamari and a kids pasta with veggie medley in a tomato sauce. Calamari was done with a light batter and fried to the right amount of crispy. The veggie medley was spectacular loaded with broccoli, carrots, mushrooms, peppers, and a tiny bit of apparatus stalks. My parents had the salmon wellington and the daily chef creation (peppercorn crusted halibut). Salmon Wellington is highly recommended and highly recommend it to share. The halibut aroma and flavor was indescribable. Kid-friendliness: They have kid friendly items that they offer but no defined kids menu. The staff were super nice and friendly towards the kids at every table while maintaining a level of professionalism for the guests without kids

HUGE portion! Delicious! Great value for money! My boyfriend and I ordered two appetizers and two mains, and we couldnt finish our food. For the main dish, I got the halibut with lobster sauce - first of all, the size of the fish was quite big, very fresh and well seasoned too. There was mushroom and shrimps in the lobster sauce. I love the generous amount of veggies they gave you. There was literally HALF a head of broccoli on my plate! My boyfriend got the salmon wellington - again, it was enormous! Everything on the plate was very tasty. The salmon was cooked to perfection and still pink on the inside. Im usually not a fan of cooked salmon because its usually dry and fishy to my taste, but this salmon dish was very well done. Not dry at all and super flavorful! It was so big that even my boyfriend couldnt finish it and had to take half home. This place is such a gem! Next time well probably just get one or two appetizers and share one main dish. Excited to try their seafood platter, smoked cod and the seafood bouillonbaisse in the future.

What a gem of a place! We are obsessed now. The food and service are stars here. You can tell dishes have been thoughtfully developed and put together by a master, forwarding quality and taste. Yes, the portions are huge, which is surprising given the ingredients. And the flavours! Was expecting the linguine to be watery and mediocre (like at Joe Fortes), but the sauce was fresh, garlicky, rich, perfectly reduced, and delectable. The mashed potatoes are dangerously addictive. We were all very happy with what we ordered. The gentleman who served us is a true professional. It was such a treat to experience his service. Humorous and gracious, he took extra care without a blink splitting a main and preparing our dad s birthday cake for us. Because we all drove, we opted not to order drinks. Most staff at restaurants at this price point would be annoyed by this and it would show. But not here. The tableware and linens were clean. The decor is dark and vintage, but adds a cozy feel. The bathrooms are humble, but also clean. The room is medium sized and the music is not too loud or trying to force a mood. We went at 5:30 and stayed til about 7/7:30 and it was very pleasant, attentive, and calm throughout. This place is simply about good food and unpretentious service that still makes you feel special and cared for. Makes you reevaluate the quality and service you receive at other restaurants that prioritize form over substance. Here it is very much about substance. Delicious substance over form. Thank you and congratulations to the team. We will be back!!

Amazing night to end off our west coast trip. Thank you Azim (Teddy Bear) for your service, you made the night extra enjoyable despite the poor weather outside. The food was absolutely delicious, hats off to the chef making such incredible dishes. I recommend everyone to try their Trio Tartars and their mussell, clam and chorizo app (its not on their menu, but show them the picture hopefully they can make it for you).  Entrees wise I had Peppercorn crust Ahi Tuna (delicious) Wife had Halibut with a name too fancy to remember (equally amazing). I saw the lobsters looked delicious too! Wish we could have a third / fourth stomach. Thanks for the memories. Will visit again when I come back to Vancouver in the future

This is my go-to place for a quality seafood meal. The service is top notch and portions are generous! The restaurant itself is very cozy and I love going here for birthdays or special occasions. Their lobster oil is mouthwatering. I could probably drink it because it s that good. The warm papaya shrimp salad was delightful. The peppercorn in the dressing gave it a nice kick. The shrimp was juicy and cooked perfectly! The mussels were also delicious. I love the white wine garlic sauce it was in. The sable fish was so buttery and paired amazingly with the lemon butter sauce. I also tried the chef s special of the day which was the halibut in a tarragon sauce. Loved the addition of mushrooms and shrimp to this dish! The salmon wellington is also a classic and you can never go wrong on this choice. Thanks Eddy and team for an exquisite dining experience!

This place was recommended by a friend and Im so happy we went. The food here was incredible! Huge portions so we were dying trying to finish everything. We didnt want anything to go to waste since it all tasted so good. Service was great. We never saw our glasses empty. It was my boyfriends birthday and they served us complimentary creme brulee. May not look like much from the outside but give this place a try and you will not be disappointed.
Just had dinner here for my birthday, delicious and amazing service/atmosphere!  I had a blackened scallop starter and a hallibut /w lobster sauce specal.  Both were fantastic.  Definitely recommend!

I have been coming here for their amazing seafood dishes at least a couple of times a year ever since they opened. Massive portions. Delicately cooked seafood. The side vegetables are so good sometimes they become the main attraction. The boss is hands on. All the servers are lovely approachable people who care about your dining experience. Just awesome.

Fairly high prices combined with no view means youre paying for quality food and service.   This is what Pink Peppercorn delivers on.  Portions are very good size, a bit old school from this perspective.   They are open to making adjustments based on dietary restrictions.   In terms of sauces, if it comes with a lobster flavor, I recommend going with that.
Very good seafood. Love their salmon wellington, halibut, and seafood pasta.

Downtown prices. Kingsway portions. Very impressed with the professional service but I will come back for the food. Sometimes you need an escape from the trendy dishes and you want a high end classic dish with a huge portion of mashed potatoes and vegetables. I really enjoyed the sablefish, but the highlight for me was my wife s bouillabaisse. That was legendary. My father also raved about the smoked black cod, a very rare dish in the Vancouver seafood scene.  They also get bonus points for offering insanely delicious chicken strips and fries for my 8 year old.

Great dinner. Everything was perfect and wonderfully cooked. Went there for my birthday and they even offered a complimentary creme brulee. Great staff, was really attentive and took her time explaining the specials of the day. Great experience though our main course did take a while to arrive. Will definitely visit again!

The best calamari Ive ever had. Nice thick and tender pieces with great tasting batter. I had a haddock off the chefs special the day I was there. It was an amazing creamy sauce that was made with the lobster oil and what an amazing unique taste I had ever experienced. The mashed potatoes was so perfectly done as well. The chef there is absolutely amazing.

When was the last time you went to a fine dining restaurant and left full AND with leftovers? Ans- At Pink Peppercorn Seafood House. The salmon wellington was the best I have ever tried, and lasted me two more meals after, because the portions are fking huge! We also ordered their seafood pasta which surprisingly (unlike other Vancouver restaurants), had more seafood than noodles. There were giant pieces of scallop and prawn which was so satisfying to see. Again, the pasta lasted us another meal as well. Service was A+ too. Not snooty, welcoming and cozy atmosphere. Take your date here to impress them! ;) For more food reviews, follow my instagram: @danism.co

Lovely meal with my family over the weekend visiting the city.  I found this restaurant from local seafood online recommendations.  Its kind of hidden and unassuming but it was a great atmosphere for group dinner. Great options for both seafood and meat lovers.  I especially loved my mussels appetizer.  The portions were pretty generous.  My son really enjoyed his chocolate dessert as well.
Nice local seafood restaurant. Delicious food. Great staff. Lovely atmosphere for the location. Really large portions !! We have been coming here for years and it has not disappointed us one bit
Tried couple of sea food dishes and lamb. They were all great & fresh. Will come back again and would like to try black cod!
Always consistent and always great service. Love this establishment. Food is delicious. A great place to celebrate any special occasion. My bestie and I celebrate our birthdays here.

Came here for my moms birthday with the fam. We ordered a few appies and a main for each of us so had a good selection to try from. The seafood tasted very fresh, portions ate quite large and presentation colorful and on point. Steaks were cooked well, asked for medium rare but more on the medium side. Mussels to start were super yummy, very meaty with good broth that went along with it. Ended up drinking up all the broth. The had ordered two tartars but I wasnt a big fan of it. Wasnt anything special. Arctic char was on special, we had ordered 3 plates of it and man were they delicious. Monk fish was fantastic. The mango salsa that accompanied it was perfect. West coast bouillabaisse was disappointing. The broth ended up being a bit bland and the seafood in the dish didnt really shine on the same level as all the other dishes. Overall everything was good except for tartar and bouillabaisse. Staff was super friendly and funny. Would come back again for sure. Great place.
If you like seafood, highly recommend this restaurant. Very satisfied. Seafood Dishes are very good and tasty. I will visit again!

A bit old school. A bit kitschy. A wonderful seafood restaurant on Kingsway. With steep prices and no view, the quality of the food and service is really what makes this place shine! My husband enjoyed the clam chowder and complimentary bread wit lobster oil. I loved the sea food platter for 1 and would highly recommend it. We shared the Alaskan smoked cod. It was a bit heavy after the other 2 dishes so I might recommend something else or maybe passing on the cream based soup. There was a small fee of $4, but the portions are huge so I recommend it.

Although the decor is outdated here, i do love the food. Especially the sauces. They are delicious. I think for what they are charging, they can definitely use an update. I love how the servers have personality. They say what they think but you dont take offence to it. The tuna was good the first time i had it and even better this second time! I do think however it was bigger the first time i tried it.
With only one day in Vancouver, my brother recommended me to visit this restaurant. And must I say he was right about it!  Love the hospitality from the waiters and the food was simply delicious.

One of the best seafood places in town! Im almost hesitant to post a review as it is such a wonderful hole-in-the-wall place. The price is of a high end place given the quality of the food (amazing everytime), great service and nice portion. My favorites from the menu are the mussels (the plumpest, never overcooked), the catfish entree (spicy crust on the blacked catfish paired with mango salsa creating the perfect flavor combo and the side of the best mashed potato youll find), the seafood fettuccini (huge chunks of fish and different types of shellfish in a delicious tomato-based sauce). Of course the complimentary lobster oil with warm toasty bread is another big PLUS!  Perfect place for special occasions or just when you feel like eating amazing seafood!
Food is so good! Generous portions! Great servers! Love this place! Hidden gem! Thanks for the great experience! Keep up the great work!
Food is delicious! Service is good Atmosphere is relaxing Price is about forty to sixty dollars per person without alcohol.

If you are looking for a great Seafood place this is it! The food here is amazing, high quality, and huge portions.... The seafood platter was awesome as an appetizer. I had the seafood pasta (picture), loaded with lots of seafood. Its probably enough for 2-3 people. I couldnt even come close to finishing it.
Food is awesome.  Service is awesome.  Didnt know until our waiter told us that they were from the cannery seafood restaurant which was also an awesome restaurant.
The biggest portions in the city. There is no shrinkflation here. Flavourful food. Service was professional and friendly. Pink Peppercorn is a place to go if you want a nice dinner out with family.
The food and service here are exemplary.   It is pricey but not ridiculous.   Portions are good tho.

Outside looks pretty rundown, but the inside is amazing!  Food was ridiculously good!  Portion is pretty big too.  I went with a group of 7 ppl, ordered 5 appy to share and 4 entrees and we had to pack like 3 plates home lol.  Its a bit pricey but for the quality and service and amount of food you get its definitely worth it!

I wish I knew about this place sooner.  Delicious and generous portions of seafood -- had order: Starters: Lobster bisque - smooth and creamy Mains: Charred Atlantic black cod -- smokey goodness 1&1/2lb Nova Scotian lobster -- so juicy Dessert: Vanilla creme brulee Our host/server Artulo was amazing and very attentive, even tho he was the only one running the floor with other tables seated. Many thumbs up for him!! Definately recommend trying this place if youre a seafood lover. Environment: nice cozy feel with perfectly lighted environment with easy-listening music that is not over the top like some restaurants now a days. Will be coming back.

Recently found out about this gem of a restaurant. Started with the Lobster bisque and the appetizer special of grilled Digby scallops. Moved on to the Seafood linguine and the Salmon wellington. Large portions, both of us brought at least half of our mains home. The staff was very attentive and knowledgeable about their menu. Well be back!
Went with another couple..all 4 of us loved our appetizers and main courses..the seafood was very fresh...the meals were huge and the service was very good
I m my opinion possibly the best seafood restaurant in town. Former chef from the Cannery restaurant opened his own seafood restaurant a few years ago. Old Cannery favorites can be found here

This restaurant is the spiritual successor to the old Vancouver seafood classic, The Cannery, which closed in 2010 after a 39 year run. The quality and preparation of the seafood   and non-seafood   items is impeccable. The service is great, including staff from The Cannery who provide continuity with the past. There are also desserts to die for, including this creme brulee, pecan pie and tiramisu. All in all, it s a great discovery in the most unlikely of neighborhoods   a definite foodie destination for Metro Vancouver.
Best food Ive ever had. If you love seafood, this place is a must.  Even the veggies were to die for. Hard to eat anything else when youve been here.
Great place for a nice quiet dinner. Excellent service with food to match. One of my favorite spots in Vancouver
I must describe this dining experience as spectacular! The service was exceptional, the presentation of the meals was a work of art and the meals were unbelievable! Theresa Food
Really amazing food and Appy and main course was great sizes. Will be going again soon. Highly recommend! Service was outstanding.

First time going to the Pink Peppercorn for our Anniversary and we will definitely be back. Very unassuming location but a fantastic find. The food was excellent and despite the place being packed we had great service. The servers are amazing and manage to make every guest feel like a regular. The lobster oil is a great starter and it was pleasantly difficult to choose what to order with so many great options on the menu. I cant wait to return to try something different.
my mom is a cancer patient and had the best birthday dinner service here last night...old school service, fresh food, great experience whats not to love

Went to Pink Peppercorn after hearing from multiple people how great it was. I was *still* shocked by how incredible the food was! The portions were generous, the salmon wellington I had was absolutely cooked to perfection. The gentlemen working there were charming, knowledgeable, and attentive. Will 100% be returning!

Wow Salmon Wellington Amazing.  I love Salmon but mainly I like Salmon raw in either sushi or sashimi.  However The Salmon Wellington is probably one of the best cooked salmon dish I have ever had.  I repeatedly return just for this dish... it is amazing!  Service is always amazing too and the decor really brings some charm.  My wife and I really like it here!
Came here for our anniversary and it was incredible.  Food was superb and so was the service.  Next time ill buy a bottle of their awesome Lobster Oil.
Everyone, better stop in often ... our dear Teddybear will be missed after 2023. Time to step away and enjoy his many hobbies. Sweet sweet kind heart !
Came here on tuesday night, they only had 1 waiter serving multiple tables, however he did an amazing job and the food was amazing as always!

Currently the building is under renovation but the restaurant is open.. quite a few items on the menu and everything we ordered was delicious..  5 Stars Kid-friendliness: We had 2 children under 10 with us.. they were thrilled with the homemade lemonade

Food here was delicious and definitely deserves more than 5 stars. Our server Paul was wonderful. He gave us amazing recommendations for the night ~ my  favourite dish was something he suggested (scallops) in a replacement of a salad that I wanted. In conclusion If you want amazing food for great price supporting great people,  this is the place for you! #supportlocalbusinesses Food: 4/4 Service : 3/3 Price: 3/3 = 12/10 + 2 extra bonus points for the history + longevity of this establishment.
The food was just fantastic  .

We have been enjoying this restaurant for many years, even before we had a business in the area!  We highly recommend this restaurant!  The food and service are top notch and we think this is the best seafood restaurant in the city!
One of the local gems food is great always fresh thats a big thing here.  Prices a bit high but completely understandable considering the portions.  A must visit.  Solid 4.5 / 5.
Price is reasonable and the dishes are valuable and delicious!!! Will visit again

One of the best seafood restaurants in town everything surpassed our expectations. The waiter was very accommodating and kind. The seafood was very fresh and juicy. I honestly recommend this spot to anyone that that lives in Vancouver. 5 Stars!
Excellent food & service. I m very impressed that they only serve wild fish. will come back again!
Classic seafood restaurant with great service. The smoked black cod always blows me away and awesome portions!
Delicious fresh seafood, reasonable prices, good service. Love the campy nautical theme interior too. Calamari was delicious!
Excellent service and delicious food as always. If you love seafood, you have to eat here and make sure you also try out their appetizers.

Omg!! This place was awesome! First time been to this place and the portion was surprisingly huge which is a bonus, also the food tasted amazing. Not only the food was good their service was very friendly too. I would definitely come here again!

We were a table for 9 people and the service was exceptional! First time trying this restaurant and I was super impressed! From all the workers (super warm and friendly), the food (absolutely delicious) and ambiance! The appetizers (Mussels and Calamari) are a must! The best in town!! The entrees were super flavourful and the portions are quite big! Thank you for having us! We loved celebrating my moms birthday at your restaurant! We will definitely be back!!!! :)

Went here on a whim, and they did not disappoint. At first, it was a little skeptical as some reviews stated small portions, but they were far from it! Definitely recommend, and will be going back when I visit again.

Absolute delight! Im glad we read the reviews ahead of time and ordered just one first course (lobster bisque) and two main course dishes (salmon wellington and seafood pasta) after reading that their portions are huge. We are going home super full and still have half of each main course dishes in take out boxes. And the flavours... my goodness. Every bite was amazing. Mere words arent enough to describe them. Oh and lets not forget their amazing fresh bread with their signature lobster oil. Our server Paul was brilliant.  He is friendly, very welcoming, and when he took photos of my husband  and me, he took multiple photos from different angles. Ladies, for those of you who know the angles matter in photos, you KNOW hes a gem. The experience from the moment we were seated to the moment we walked out the door after a lovely gesture (complimentary cream brule) to wish us happy anniversary was very memorable and we look forward to trying other dishes from their menu next time.

What can I say about this place, the price matches  the quality with an over abundance of food (you will NOT leave hungry) is amazing, not to mention the service, above the rest. I highly recommend this place. This place has been around for years. They were once known as the cannery and have reopened at this location, for I believe the waiter mentioned, 15 Years now. they still believe in the white cloth service and let me tell you, the service is nothing but first class.

This place should have more recognition. The place was incredible; the flavour was so unique, everything was cooked to perfection. The creation from the chef was impressive; we ordered the Salmon Wellington, the scallops as an entry and the scallops and shrimp as the main, and it was one of the best food we had in Vancouver.

Everytime I dine here, the food quality is superb, along with professional & efficient service from the wait staff.  Portions are large, seafood and vegetables are fresh and so beautifully plated.     So happy Chef Eddy and his staff decided to carry on the fine dining experience from the iconic Cannery.

Absolutely enjoyed my dinner last night at this classic restaurant! From the moment I walked in, friendly attentive waiters that made you feel so welcome, an excellent menu (I hardly know what to choose, everything looks so tempting!) and a cosy yet elegant setting. Although this restaurant specialises in seafood but they also serve a really great rack of lamb. For starters, the Trio of Tartare was an explosion of fun flavours, with salmon, tuna and scallop. I am pretty sure the rest of the menu wont disappoint either, definitely will return in the future. Highly recommend when you are looking for something special for dinner.

This is truly a hidden gem if you are a seafood lover like myself, just must try. All the dishes we ordered were delicious. The atmosphere inside the restaurant was very charming and one of the best service experiences.
That food was amazing.  The server was super friendly and very helpful. We will definitely return.

This place has excellent service. Food  is A plus. The size of the main dish is very generous and fulfilling. They will provide you sour dough bread with lobster oil while you wait for the food to arrive. Other the dishes on the menu, they have daily special.  I went there to celebrate my aunt birthday, while we have dessert they give us a bonus Creme brulee as a birthday surprise for my aunt. Everyone is very happy with the food and my aunt had a wonderful birthday dinner. Definitely will be back for special events

This is one of my favourite hole in the wall restaurants to dine at!  Their food is always delicious and consistent and the service is great!  For a non pretentious fine dining food experience, this is the place to go. The decor is nothing fancy or modern but the food and portions sizes make up for it.  I recommend a few appetizers, especially the warm prawn and papaya salad, muscles and calamari!
Salmon Wellington is highly recommended. Mashed potatoes are sweet as well as the gravy. All round great seafood spot with excellent service

Took my mom here for her 85th-wow! Two waiters for the entire restaurant served us right! We had soup and seafood platter to start-amazing. My mom had scallops and prawns and I had the smoked black cod and both dishes were fantastic. The decor has the old school seafood house theme and all the tables were lit nicely with clean white  linens. Cant say enough about the two waiters marathoning the dinning room! We will be back for sure, the food was better and bigger than the keg and the bill was smaller! Ps they gave my mom a creme brule on the house for her birthday. *****
